Albania: Siege of Berat (1280–1281): An Angevin offensive against Constantinople was repulsed by the Byzantines.
Spain: Battle of Moclín (1280): A force consisting of Castilian soldiers and most of the Order of Santiago was wiped out by a Granadan army at Moclín while returning from a raid.
Sweden: The Ordinance of Alsnö gives birth to the frälse, a class of tax-exempt secular nobility, in Sweden.
